outboundReferences.contextLine: [[DNS]] record types are used to map domain names to IP addresses and other information. Here are some of the main DNS record types and their descriptions:

Also known as a [[tls]] authentication record, it maps a domain name to the certificate or public key of a server. This record is used to authenticate the server’s identity and establish a secure connection. For example, a TLSA record for the domain name _443._tcp.example.com could be _443._tcp.example.com. IN TLSA 3 1 1 abcd....

inboundReferences.contextLine: Azure DNS supports ALIAS [[dns-record-type]] sets; you can use an alias record set to refer to an Azure resource and, in case it changes, the DNS records are automatically updated.
